page.title: 04RAYDON WOMEN'S CLUB
page.content: This organisation called the Women's Fellowship was formed in 1974 by the Salvation Army and met in the Army hall fortnightly on a Wednesday evening.It is a group of ladies from all denominations who enjoy listening to talks and demonstrations and visiting places of interest.The speakers include the following:Citizens Advice Bureau,Marks and Spencers,Candle Maker, Guide dog for the Blind,Life in a Prisoner of war camp.Demonstrations include Makeup,Butchery,Deep fat frying.They have visited many places such as Police H.Q.Telephone exchange,Colchester Town Hall,A bakery.Twice a year they have a meal out in different restaurants. When the Salvation Army closed in Raydon in 1982 the Women's Fellowship moved to the sports paviiion on Raydon playing field.
